alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; Superior (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 1:40PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 230 PM MST... At 140 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boyce Thompson Arboretum, or near Superior, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Superior, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, Boyce Thompson Arboretum and Top-Of-The-World. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 212 and 234. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 149 and 150. AZ Route 177 between mile markers 162 and 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; Superior
